ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about Spanish-speaking countries and how to compare cultures and a wide variety of grammar and vocabulary.
How to speak spanish.
I learned many more verb tenses, and vocabulary in Spanish. I think it was helpful in a basic understanding of Spanish.
Speaking, presenting and reading
I learned lots of grammar and vocabulary. I was able to better comprehend and speak Spanish by the end of the course.
Several tenses and lots of new vocab (including on wildlife, healthcare, shopping)
I have learned to be more proficient in the Spanish language as well as learn more about the culture.
I definitely improved my listening and speaking skills in Spanish.
Expanded my understanding of the Spanish language and culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths are the asynchronous day on Wednesday, but I do think there is too much homework and that the homework gets repetitive.

We learned so much in a week, but diddn't always have time to review. I wish we reviewed our Supersite learning assignments the next day, because there were many grammar topics that I feel were not talked about or reviewed in class, yet still on the exam.
Professor is great. Weakness is meeting 4/5 days a week.

Strengths: Teaches you a lot
Weaknesses: Sometimes unclear expectations about what assignments require from you - for example, some activities seem like you could write a paragraph, but they will actually require a page of writing. (No warning - points are just taken off).
It covers a wide array of topics. I would like more chances to present in front of the class to build speaking skills.

Strengths -- meeting 4 days a week in person helped a lot with learning to speak the language. Having the LinguaMeetings really helped, as well.

Weaknesses -- went through the grammar too quickly for it to absorb.
Daily classes take a lot of time but mean you learn very quickly and have to keep on top of work.
I think there was a lot of busy work that could have possibly been cut out but I think all the in class things were very helpful.

Strengths: the rigor and daily requirement forces us to learn the language. I like the conversations and group work done in class because it encourages the students to bond and learn more about each other while practicing spanish. 
Weakness: there is an overreliance on VHL which can be a bad method for practice because it can sometimes have confusing questions and super specific answers that the students cannot naturally get to without having to use a peer's answers. Also, the writing requirement to get full credit on assignments can be ridiculous and strenuous on students when we have to write multiple paragraphs to do well on an assignment which incentives online resources like Google Translate being used.

I think that the Wednesday free days are unhelpful. I would rather have class 4 days per week - or maybe Wednesday's could be dedicated to a Spanish drama series or something that immerse us in the language in a less active or involved manner (as to allow our brains to rest in a similar manner as the current schedule allows).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, because it is manageable and the classroom is a welcoming environment.
Yes if you want to continue your spanish learning.
Yes, helpful in a basic understanding of spanish.
Yes
Yes, if you want to learn more grammar and vocabulary and bolster your Spanish language skills.
Yes, excellent Spanish program
I would recommend it if they were wanting to learn Spanish.
I would if they are really committed to learning Spanish but if they just want a chill course to learn Spanish recreationally this would not be the class.
Absolutely. Wish I would've taken it every semester of my MBA career.
